The simulation tracks water phase (alpha.water) using MULES with 2 alpha correctors, 1 alpha subcycle, and cAlpha of 1. Set refinement levels of (1,1) for pipe surface and (1000,2) for pipeWall region with 40 cells across span, using inside point at (1e-5, 1e-5, 1e-5) for mesh generation. Run simulation from time 0 to 0.5 seconds with initial timestep of 0.001, adjustable timestepping enabled with maximum Courant numbers of 2 for both velocity and alpha, maximum timestep of 1, and output every 0.02 seconds using adjustableRunTime control.

Generate a spherical mesh geometry using blockMesh solver with a searchable sphere of radius 1 unit centered at the origin (0,0,0). The mesh consists of a single hexahedral block with 10x10x10 cells using simple grading, where vertices are positioned at coordinates (±0.5773502, ±0.5773502, ±0.5773502) to form a cube that is projected onto the sphere surface. All six faces of the hexahedral block are projected onto the sphere geometry and designated as 'walls' boundary with wall-type boundary conditions. The mesh uses a scale factor of 1 and employs curved edges defined by arcs to maintain the spherical shape during projection. This is a mesh generation case running from time 0 to 10 with a timestep of 1 and output written every timestep for mesh quality verification purposes.

Conduct a dynamic mesh deformation simulation using moveDynamicMesh solver with motionSolver mover type displacementSBRStress. The domain is a 3D rectangular canyon geometry with dimensions 2700m (659600 to 662300) in x-direction, 3100m (4.7514e+06 to 4.7545e+06) in y-direction, and 1072m (1028 to 2100) in z-direction with convertToMeters factor of 1. Use a structured mesh with 20x60x60 cells and simpleGrading of (10.0 1 1) in x-direction. The minZ boundary uses surfaceDisplacement with velocity (10 10 10) m/s projected onto AcrossRiver.stl surface geometry using fixedNormal projectMode in z-direction (0 0 1), while maxZ boundary has fixedValue displacement of (0 0 0). All side boundaries (maxX, minX, minY, maxY) use fixedNormalSlip conditions with appropriate normal vectors. Set kinematic viscosity nu to 0.01 m²/s. Run simulation from time 0 to 25 seconds with timestep of 1 second, outputting results every 5 timesteps using binary format. Use quadratic inverseDistance diffusivity for mesh motion with reference to minZ boundary and decompose for parallel processing using 2 subdomains with hierarchical method (2 1 1).

do a 2D mesh generation using foamyQuadMesh solver for a jagged boundary geometry defined by jaggedBoundary.stl surface file. Extract surface features with an included angle of 175 degrees and subset features using a plane defined by point (-0.6, 0.3, 0) with normal vector (0, 0, 1). Extrude the 2D mesh to create a quasi-2D domain using linearDirection extrude model with 1 layer in the z-direction, thickness of 0.1 units in the (0, 0, 1) direction, expansion ratio of 1.0, and empty patch type for front and back faces. Run the mesh generation process from time 0 to 100 with a timestep of 1 and output results every timestep with ASCII format and 12-digit precision.

do a 2D mesh generation simulation using foamyQuadMesh solver to create a quadrilateral mesh for a unit cube geometry. The domain is based on a unit_cube.stl surface file with feature extraction using an included angle of 175 degrees and open edges enabled. Use extrude2DMesh with wedge model to create a wedge-type mesh with axis point at (0 0 0), axis direction (1 0 0), and sector angle of 10 degrees. The simulation runs from time 0 to 100 with a timestep of 1 and output every timestep. Enable shortEdgeFilter2D debug switch set to 0 for mesh quality control during the meshing process.

Conduct a mesh generation simulation using foamyHexMesh solver to create a high-quality hexahedral mesh for a blob-shaped geometry. The mesh generation process should run for 80 time units with a timestep of 1 unit and output results at the final time (interval of 80). Configure mesh quality controls with maximum non-orthogonality of 65 degrees, maximum boundary skewness of 50, maximum internal skewness of 10, maximum concave angle of 80 degrees, minimum tetrahedral quality of 1e-30, minimum volume of -1e30, minimum twist of 0.001, minimum determinant of 0.001, minimum face weight of 0.02, and minimum volume ratio of 0.01. Enable edge collapse control with minimum edge length of 1e-6 and maximum merge angle of 180 degrees. Set face collapse parameters with initial face length factor of 0.5, maximum collapse face-to-point side length coefficient of 0.3, early collapse coefficient of 0.2, and guard fraction of 0.1. Configure mesh quality control with edge reduction factor of 0.5, face reduction factor of 0.5, maximum smoothing iterations of 2, maximum iterations of 10, and maximum point error count of 3. Use scotch decomposition method for parallel processing with 2 subdomains.

Perform a mesh generation simulation using foamyHexMesh solver to create a high-quality hexahedral mesh for simple geometric shapes. The mesh generation process should run from time 0 to 80 with a timestep of 1 and output results every 80 timesteps at the final time. Configure mesh quality controls with maximum non-orthogonality of 65 degrees, maximum boundary skewness of 50, maximum internal skewness of 10, maximum concave angle of 80 degrees, minimum tetrahedral quality of 1e-30, minimum twist of 0.001, minimum determinant of 0.001, minimum face weight of 0.02, and minimum volume ratio of 0.01. Set up edge collapse controls with minimum edge length of 1e-6, maximum merge angle of 180 degrees, initial face length factor of 0.5, maximum collapse face-to-point side length coefficient of 0.3, early collapse coefficient of 0.2, and guard fraction of 0.1. Use GAMG solver for displacement correction with tolerance of 1e-06, relative tolerance of 0.99, Gauss-Seidel smoother, and 6 cells in the coarsest level. Apply stress analysis with 1 corrector, displacement tolerance of 1e-10, and acceleration factor of 2. Employ cubic gradient and divergence schemes, linear uncorrected Laplacian schemes, and cubic interpolation schemes with uncorrected surface normal gradient schemes.

Perform a mesh refinement operation using refineMesh solver on a 3D curved domain with dimensions spanning from x=0.31 to x=18.29, y=-12.93 to y=0, and z=-1.07 to z=4.39 with convertToMeters factor of 1. The domain features curved edges defined by arc coordinates and is discretized with a base mesh of 47x10x4 cells using simpleGrading (41.67, 1, 1). Apply patch boundary conditions on six surfaces: maxX, minX, maxY, minY, maxZ, and minZ patches. Execute multiple refinement tiers based on radiusFieldXY field values: tier1 (0.0-0.64), tier2 (0.0-1.03), tier3 (0.0-1.94), tier4 (0.0-3.67), tier5 (0.0-7.00), tier6 (0.0-13.36), and range operations (range1: 13.36-18.47, range2: 7.00-18.47, range3: 3.67-18.47). Use global coordinate system with e1=(1,0,0) and e2=(0,1,0) for tier refinements and fieldBased coordinate system with radial, angular, and height directions for range refinements. Set refinement direction as e3 for tiers and multi-directional for ranges, disable hexTopology, enable geometricCut, and disable writeMesh. Run simulation from startTime 0 to endTime 1000 with deltaT 1.0 and writeInterval 1 using potentialFoam application with binary output format.

Perform a structural stress analysis simulation using solidEquilibriumDisplacementFoam solver on a rectangular beam geometry with dimensions 30 units length, 1 unit height, and 1 unit width (convertToMeters factor of 1). The beam has a fixed displacement boundary condition (fixedValue with zero displacement) at the fixedEnd (left end at x=0), a traction load of 10000 N/m² applied in the y-direction at the tractionEnd (right end at x=30), and traction-free boundary conditions (tractionDisplacement with zero traction and pressure) on the topSurface and bottomSurface. Use a structured hexahedral mesh with 6 cells in x-direction, 2 cells in y-direction, and 1 cell in z-direction. Set material properties for steel with density of 7854 kg/m³, Young's modulus of 2e11 Pa, Poisson's ratio of 0 (nu), thermal conductivity of 60.5 W/m·K, specific heat capacity of 434 J/kg·K, and thermal expansion coefficient of 1.1e-05 /K. Configure the simulation as plane stress analysis with thermal stress disabled. Run the simulation from time 0 to 10 seconds with a timestep of 2e-05 seconds, outputting results every 0.025 seconds using GAMG solver with tolerance of 1e-06 and one corrector iteration in the stressAnalysis algorithm.

Perform a plane stress structural analysis simulation using solidDisplacementFoam solver for a plate with a circular hole subjected to tensile loading. The domain represents a quarter-symmetry model with symmetry boundary conditions applied at the left and down boundaries. Apply a uniform traction of 10000 Pa in the x-direction at the right boundary to simulate tensile loading, while the up boundary and hole surface have zero traction conditions. The frontAndBack faces are designated as empty for 2D analysis. Set material properties for steel with density of 7854 kg/m³, Young's modulus of 2e11 Pa, Poisson's ratio of 0.3, specific heat capacity of 434 J/kg·K, thermal conductivity of 60.5 W/m·K, and thermal expansion coefficient of 1.1e-05 /K. Initialize displacement field D to zero throughout the domain and temperature T to uniform 300 K with zero gradient boundary conditions at all non-symmetry boundaries. Use plane stress formulation with thermal stress effects disabled. Run the simulation from time 0 to 100 with a timestep of 1, outputting results every 20 timesteps. Employ GAMG solver with Gauss-Seidel smoother for both displacement and temperature fields with tolerance of 1e-06 and use leastSquares gradient schemes with linear interpolation for spatial discretization.
